channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [AVRO-173] Add "avroj version" command
item.description: AVRO-149 introduced "avroj"; would be nice for it to have a "version" command.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The "version" command might include the content of the NOTICE.txt file.

For example, it might look like:

Avro Java command line client version X.Y.Z.

Apache Avro
Copyright 2009 The Apache Software Foundation

This product includes software developed at
The Apache Software Foundation (http://www.apache.org/).
This was fixed by AVRO-320.

item.title: [AVRO-174] Add appropriate license files to "avroj.jar"
item.description: AVRO-149 took all the dependencies for avroj and stuffed them into one jar. We should in some way bundle that with all the relevant licenses.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The avroj jar is the Work in Object form. The Apache License states:

   4. Redistribution. You may reproduce and distribute copies of the
      Work or Derivative Works thereof in any medium, with or without
      modifications, and in Source or Object form, provided that You
      meet the following conditions:

      (a) You must give any other recipients of the Work or
          Derivative Works a copy of this License; and

      (b) You must cause any modified files to carry prominent notices
          stating that You changed the files; and

      (c) You must retain, in the Source form of any Derivative Works
          that You distribute, all copyright, patent, trademark, and
          attribution notices from the Source form of the Work,
          excluding those notices that do not pertain to any part of
          the Derivative Works; and

      (d) If the Work includes a "NOTICE" text file as part of its
          distribution, then any Derivative Works that You distribute must
          include a readable copy of the attribution notices contained
          within such NOTICE file, excluding those notices that do not
          pertain to any part of the Derivative Works, in at least one
          of the following places: within a NOTICE text file distributed
          as part of the Derivative Works; within the Source form or
          documentation, if provided along with the Derivative Works; or,
          within a display generated by the Derivative Works, if and
          wherever such third-party notices normally appear. The contents
          of the NOTICE file are for informational purposes only and
          do not modify the License. You may add Your own attribution
          notices within Derivative Works that You distribute, alongside
          or as an addendum to the NOTICE text from the Work, provided
          that such additional attribution notices cannot be construed
          as modifying the License.

So we should include all the license files and the NOTICE.txt in the tarball.
This was fixed by AVRO-320.

item.title: [AVRO-175] Split the avro_io interface into two interface: avro_reader and avro_writer
item.description:
This patch was inspired by feedback I've received from Thiru. Thanks Thiru!

This patch makes two interface changes:

1. It splits avro_io into avro_io_reader and avro_io_writer
2. It splits avro_channel into avro_reader and avro_writer

It also includes an update to the README and configure asciiart.
item.summary: Split the avro_io interface into two interface: avro_reader and avro_writer

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r831615 | massie | 2009-10-31 16:19:10 -0700 (Sat, 31 Oct 2009) | 2 lines

AVRO-175. Split the avro_io interface into two interfaces: avro_reader and avro_writer

item.title: [AVRO-176] file status is not checked before attempting to read it in c++
item.description: When an istream object is passed to the avro compiler, it doesn't check if the file is actually opened successfully before attempting to read it. This leads to a bug when the wrong path for a schema file is provided.
item.summary: file status is not checked before attempting to read it in c++

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Adds a safeguard check for a bad istream. Also adds unit tests for it.

item.title: [AVRO-177] upgrade to current Jackson release
item.description: Avro should probably use a more recent version of Jackson.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here's a patch. All tests pass for me with this.

I just committed this.

I also upgraded other Java dependencies to their most recent stable releases.

item.title: [AVRO-178] Add the AC_CONFIG_MACRO_DIR m4 macro for newer versions of autoconf
item.description:
Simple patch to add

AC_CONFIG_MACRO_DIR([m4]) to configure.in

and

ACLOCAL_AMFLAGS=-I m4 to Makefile.am

for newer version of autotools.
item.summary: Add the AC_CONFIG_MACRO_DIR m4 macro for newer versions of autoconf

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This was such a small change I simply added it to the AVRO-179 checkin
